```{r}
data2 = read_csv("ANNUAL NUMBER OF EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT VISITS FOR HRI.csv")

data2 = data2 %>% 
  select(1:4, 7) %>% 
  pivot_wider(names_from = `Age Group`,
              values_from = Value) %>% 
  rename(ER_visits_hri_age_0_4 = `0 TO 4`) %>% 
  rename(ER_visits_hri_age_5_14 = `5 TO 14`) %>% 
  rename(ER_visits_hri_age_15_34 = `15 TO 34`) %>% 
  rename(ER_visits_hri_age_35_64 = `35 TO 64`) %>% 
  rename(ER_visits_hri_age_over_65 = `>= 65`) %>% 
  mutate(total_ER_visits = ER_visits_hri_age_0_4 + ER_visits_hri_age_5_14 + ER_visits_hri_age_15_34 + ER_visits_hri_age_35_64 + ER_visits_hri_age_over_65)

data2
```
```{r}
combined_d1_d2 = inner_join(data1, data2) 

combined_d1_d2_small = combined_d1_d2 %>% 
  filter(total_ER_visits > 100)

ggplot(combined_d1_d2_small, aes(x = ANNUAL_MEDIAN_HOUSEHOLD_INCOME, y = total_ER_visits)) +
  geom_point()
```
```{r}
model = lm(total_ER_visits ~ ANNUAL_MEDIAN_HOUSEHOLD_INCOME, data = combined_d1_d2_small)
summary(model)

plot(model)
```


# Note that we were not able to get daily data on the average temperate so we are just finding the total amount of very hot days across the year

#The number of counties don't appear to change year to year


```{r}
data3 = read_csv("ANNUAL NUMBER OF EXTREME HEAT DAYS.csv")

county_count = data3 %>%
  distinct(State, County) %>%  
  count(State, name = "num_counties")  

data3_modified <- data3 %>%
  select(1:6, 9) %>% 
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = `Heat Metric"Absolute Threshold`,
    values_from = Value
  ) %>%
  rename(
    days_over_90_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature"Absolute Threshold: 90 degrees F`,
    days_over_95_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature\"Absolute Threshold: 95 degrees F`,
    days_over_100_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature\"Absolute Threshold: 100 degrees F`,
    days_over_105_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature\"Absolute Threshold: 105 degrees F`
  )

# Step 3: Sum across counties for each state/year
data3_summarized <- data3_modified %>%
  group_by(State, Year) %>%
  summarize(across(starts_with("days_over"), sum, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

# Step 4: Join county count and divide to get average
data3_final <- data3_summarized %>%
  left_join(county_count, by = "State") %>%
  mutate(across(starts_with("days_over"), ~ .x / num_counties))

data3_final
```

```{r}
data4 = read_csv("ANNUAL NUMBER OF HOSPITLIZATIONS FOR HRI.csv")

              values_from = Value) %>% 
  rename(HSP_visits_age_0_4 = `0 TO 4`) %>% 
  rename(HSP_visits_age_5_14 = `5 TO 14`) %>%

```

```{r}
data5 = read_csv("ANNUAL NUMBER OF EXTREME HEAT EVENTS.csv")

# Step 1: Count counties per state (like you did before)
county_count <- data5 %>%
  distinct(State, County) %>%
  count(State, name = "num_counties")

# Step 2: Pivot wider to get HE columns
data5_wide <- data5 %>%
  select(1:6, 9) %>%
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = `Heat Metric\"Minimum Duration Days\"Absolute Threshold`,
    values_from = Value
  ) %>%
  rename(
    HE_over_90_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature\"Minimum Duration Days: 2 days\"Absolute Threshold: 90 degrees F`,
    HE_over_95_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature\"Minimum Duration Days: 2 days\"Absolute Threshold: 95 degrees F`,
    HE_over_100_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature\"Minimum Duration Days: 2 days\"Absolute Threshold: 100 degrees F`,
    HE_over_105_degrees = `Heat Metric: Daily Maximum Temperature\"Minimum Duration Days: 2 days\"Absolute Threshold: 105 degrees F`
  )

# Step 3: Sum across counties (per state-year)
data5_summarized <- data5_wide %>%
  group_by(State, Year) %>%
  summarise(across(starts_with("HE_over"), sum, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

# Step 4: Average by dividing by number of counties
data5_final <- data5_summarized %>%
  left_join(county_count, by = "State") %>%
  mutate(across(starts_with("HE_over"), ~ .x / num_counties))

data5_final
  
```
